title: How to define math in a word - Quora

response.answer_text: Scary To be honest, I am good at math. I am capable of solving logic questions and have no problem in solving questions related to reasoning ability. Now the problem is, I dont like Maths at all. But why? I get panicked when I am unable to solve a question or understand the formula.  Story Time: Few months back, I had a Maths test in school. The topics were Trigonometry and Polynomials. I was fully prepared. I was pretty much confident in myself. Until…… I saw the question paper. All hell broke loose. It seemed like I did not know any question written on that paper. I was terrified. I wanted to ace this test and pass with an A grade. And then, I had an anxiety attack. My neck and spine started aching like anything. I could feel my heartbeat growing faster every second. I was about to faint. After 15 minutes, I got up and reported my invigillator that I am sick. After a few minutes, I was sitting on a clinic bed.I remember requesting the teachers that my condition is not good, and I cannot complete the test. But they forced me to solve the paper, whatsoever my health condition was. Somehow, I managed to solve a few questions. When the test was over, I was sent back home. The next week, I heard a news which was a slap on my face. I scored 15 out of 30. C grade. And from that moment, I had sworn to myself that after passing 10th grade (which I am in right now) I would never ever study Maths. Not even a single topic.  Conclusion: I hate Maths. Maths hates me.

Motivation Why motivation? Because I am shite at it. Confuse?..Allow me to elaborate…. I love maths, I get why so many people are completely obsessed with this subject, it is at the same time elegant yet ruthlessly direct, simple yet complex, impossible yet beautiful, maths is like classic poetry, the words might seem like complete garbage just men’t to confuse but a good dictionary and a patient instructor can show you just how beautiful it is, how every word echoes a different emotion and is irreplaceable( forgive me for getting a bit too philosophical) . The time I fell in love with maths was when I learnt a proof for why there are infinite prime numbers. A very basic and ‘elegant’ solution first proved by Euclid in 300 BC, but I digress. Maths motivates me because I am so shit in it, even though I love the subject there is room for tremendous improvement. Maths reminds me of the fact that I can become a far better version of myself and this motivates me to work harder ;if that makes any sense. Also there is a saying that “If the universe is like an epic poem , then mathematics is the language in which it was written” ;so I think if I can master this subject, I can perhaps better understand this universe ; something which has been my obsession since childhood
I would like to define Math as: “Keira” Full name is “Keira Knightley”  Because both are out of my reach. I can never get both of them even if i try. :( Thanks.
Let us assume the word is “x” ;)

Crush. Math is like my crush. They will give you that warm feeling inside. You get excited for the smallest things that involve them. Figuring out ways that you can get their attention (solve them - in case of math) or simply just impress them. When everything they do makes you happy ( excites you) and everything they say ( tricks of math) puts a smile on your face. Although, a crush is a crush, but everyday you're just hoping it will lead to something more.

LOVE ! Maths is like love; don't be surprised . I'll explain. Maths is like love, some of us find happiness in it; but for many of us, it's the ocean of sorrow. Some of us find maths easy ; but for many of us , it's the difficult stuff. Just like love, maths searches for X. ;-)  For a single problem, there are multiple ways of solution. Just like love, maths will be your temporary subject ( short relationships) or it may accompany you lifetime (long relationships). Sometimes it's simple, sometimes complicated. It's not as simple as it seems!
Let the word be ‘x’ Jokes apart. Well Math for me is “FOCUS” It is something which calls for your focus to get solved !

Logic Theory Practice Technique Intelligence Though, none of these words are enough to represent math in a single word, here I have other options to represent math.....,Do not laugh, ok ? Option A : M=Mentally A=Affected T=Teachers H=Harrasing S=Students Option B : M=Mental A=Attack T=To H=Healthy S=Students Option C : M=Mental A=Abuse T=To H=Humans I hope, math teachers would not read this answer on quora,…..

Chill You can actually do anything you wish while doing maths. Play music, YouTube, talk to your friend, eat pastries or pizza, anything you wish to! Just understand the concept once and then any question becomes a piece of cake. You can't do any of these (except eating) while doing any other subject like social studies or science or English. So three cheers for maths!

Everything Mathematics led to everything else, it led to the places that nobody else had ever seen or heard of or previously imagined; it was like a drug; an ultimately liberating, utterly enhancing, unadulterably beneficial, overpoweringly glorious drug for the intellect of machines as far beyond the sagacity of the human mind as they were beyond its understanding.

Language A system of communication with more exactness and less context sensitiveness. You can use this language to communicate among homogenous systems and non-homogenous systems as well. Actually any two systems. Natural laws can be communicated to humans; human emotions can be communicated to machines; machines can communicate with each other. Physics can communicate with chemistry. Pick any two systems - they can communicate with this universal language.

Art of exploring imaginations and reality Math is the art of extending the visible world to some sense where we can use it for some other extended purpose.Math is to search for invisible dots that we need to connect to resolve several of our needs which are yet unknown to us.Maths is a world of using mind so logically or illogically that even every invisible or visible objects look like beautifully organized in rhythm of sense.

Builder :- Just like weight training builds the muscles, in the same way mathematics builds our brain stronger as it acts as a food for our brain. In his insightful book- The Equation for Excellence: How to make your child Excel in Maths, Arvin Vohra reveals a simple and powerful concept that most people overlook. In a nutshell, he points out that you don't do Maths because you are smart; you do Maths because it makes you smarter. Thus, the concrete and abstract thinking required by Maths builds the brain's muscles which in turn prepare us for other academic pursuits and to increase overall intelligence!!!
It's a funny one: My sibling told me this as he heard in his school. M- Meri A- Aatma T- Tujhe H- Hardam S- Sataegi When I heard this, I was seriously rolling on the floor laughing..:)

MASTURBATION  maths is a beautiful way to express the world. it is unlike others , independent , self sufficient. without it i doubt there is any way to express the universe. maths is truly the way we can understand the universe it is the language of gods. now its really masturbation if you ask to someone who loves physics. independent , self sufficient but lacks the KICK without its practical application in others(eg, physics , economics). ps. sorry mathematicians.

Subject Merely a subject… its just even if u don’t feel it difficult u create it difficult in your mind just because eveyone says it’s very difficult.. You only need to concentrate and focus to be good at maths… keep your concepts clear .. think, practice, apply, that’s all… as simple as that… Don’t think what u don’t know about the question instead think what u know about it .. and see automatically it becomes easy and u feel u can do it rather than keeping it unsolved.. All the best … give your best

One word is not enough to describe prodigiousness of mathematics. Here are few words that define math to me : Beautiful! Fascinating! Mesmerising! The essence of mathematics lies in its freedom. -Georg Cantor PS. I love math :)

Time! I think this word defines math! The exact time, minutes, seconds! Some emergencies take life in seconds, some people wait years with patience for accomplishing their goal..it makes life dull wasting a day! So all this is calculated..time is a word that describes math the best I think.. yesterday, today, tomorrow, day, month, year, anniversaries, moments, service all calculated..cherished and people remember the time.

Magical Because the more you get into it, more you'll discover new tricks to solve a particular question. If studied properly and whole heartedly, maths is really very interesting subject. Atleast it is not like other subjects where people try to learn everything without understanding.
Quantity Equations Patterns Everything in this universe can be quantified. Every phenomenon is governed by mathematical equation and there are patterns in everything just need to find out.
Universal! Inescapable! Omnipresent! Ubiquitous! A ghost which can never leave you alone :p

Math is just fun ! The freedom we have to do whatever we want with just the little we have! Philosophy! But enjoying boundless freedom is what that makes it the best world to live in! I dare you Try to enjoy the freedom in this world !
